prp:ObsProposal.prp:abstract: The information of molecular gas in less massive galaxies at z<1 is a missing piece for drawing a complete picture of galaxy formation and evolution. We propose to observe dust continuum emissions (~343 GHz) of 35 less-massive galaxies with log(M_star/M_sun)<10.5 at z~0.5-1.5 to measure molecular gas mass as a proxy of time-consuming molecular line observations. The dust mass in these galaxies will be estimated accurately by applying the SED-fit technique to the data of ALMA (0.9 mm) and Herschel (100 and 160 um). Then we evaluate the cold gas mass with metallicity dependent dust-to-gas ratios. This observation allows us to verify the mass dependence on the evolution of molecular gas fraction we found, and will provide a new observational constraint for the galaxy formation theories in terms of gas accretion and outflow.

prp:PrincipalInvestigator.prp:organisation: Nobeyama Radio Observatory, National Astronomical Observatory of Japan

prp:CoInvestigator.prp:organisation: Center for Computational Astrophysics, National Astronomical Observatory of Japan
Graduate School of Science, Kyoto University
Nobeyama Radio Observatory, National Astronomical Observatory of Japan
